topic.title: Deploying Content Fusion Enterprise on Amazon Web Services

keywords.indexterm: Installing an Enterprise server with Amazon Web Services

body.p: There are two ways to launch on Amazon Web Services: using the launch button or the EC2 wizard. The first approach is more simple but not as flexible as the second one, although it should be sufficient for evaluation purposes.

section.title: Using the Launch Button (recommended for evaluation purposes only)
section.p:
Prerequisites:
An Amazon Web Services account. This setup will require resources that are not covered by the free tier.
An SSH key pair in the Canada (Central) region. You can create one following this tutorial.

Procedure:
Go to the Download page.
Go to the AWS tab and click Launch on AWS.
Make sure you have the Canada (Central) region selected. You can change it using the drop-down menu in the top-right corner.
In the SSHKeyName, choose the name of an existing SSH key pair. It will be used for SSH access to the instance.If there are no options provided in the combo-box, see the prerequisites.
Review and click Create.
Result: The machine will launch. Expand the Resources tab to present a link to your launched instance where you can find details about the running instance, including its IP address (you will need this).
Continue configuring .

section.title: Using the EC2 Wizard (recommended for production)
section.p: Prerequisites: An Amazon Web Services account. This setup will require resources which are not covered by the free tier.

ol.li: Make sure you have the Canada (Central) region selected. You can change it using the drop-down menu in the top-right corner.

Choose the Amazon Machine Image:
Switch to the Community AMIs tab.
Insert the AMI ID listed on the download page in the search field.
Click the Select button.
Choose the Instance Type. It is recommended that you use at least a t2.medium instance (2 vCPUs, 4 GiB Memory) or higher, depending on the expected activity.

Configure Instance Details. You can leave all options with their default values, except for:
Enable termination protection: Enabled
Auto-assign Public IP: Enable
Add Storage. The /dev/sdb volume will be used to store the database and files uploaded by the users as part of the review tasks. It is preconfigured to be 100GiB and can be adjusted here.
Add Tags. Adding the name tag might be useful to identify the instance and volumes attached to it more easily.

Configure Security Group. Select or create a security group with the following inbound rules:
port 80, source Anywhere
port 443, source Anywhere
port 22, source My IP (recommended) or Anywhere (for SSH administrative access)
port 9080, source My IP (recommended) or Anywhere (for web-based administrative access)

Click Review and Launch. You will be asked to select a key pair or create a new one.
Result: The machine will launch and you will be presented with a link to your launched instance where you can find details about the running instance, including its IP address (you will need this).
